name: Givelight Foundation
mission: Givelight Foundations primary exempt purpose is to provide shelter, clothing and food to children who have been orphaned by a natural disaster or other global crisis; to provide educational, spiritual and social services to the children residing in these orphanages.
theoryOfChange: Givelight Foundation has a section on their website titled 'Our Model' which outlines their strategic approach to establishing and running orphanages globally. This model details a step-by-step process, including researching credible organizations, selecting partners based on specific criteria, acquiring donated land, and staffing homes with qualified individuals. The approach emphasizes a need-based method to identify immediate needs of children and focuses on their long-term care and education. The organization's mission is to build and sustain loving homes and provide high-quality education, aiming to recreate a family environment and foster a strong sense of identity and self-esteem for the children under their care. Furthermore, Charity Navigator indicates that Givelight Foundation demonstrates strategic thinking through its articulated mission and implements 'Evaluation and Learning Programs' to track progress towards its outcomes. Their future goals include caring for 10,000 orphans worldwide and achieving specific educational milestones for the children.

rich_narrative.summary: The GiveLight Foundation is a global humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">long-term care and loving homes for orphaned children</cite> facing extreme crises. Founded in <cite id="2">2004</cite> in response to the devastating Indian Ocean tsunami, the organization has expanded its reach to manage <cite id="3">orphanage construction and management</cite> across multiple countries including <cite id="4">Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka</cite>. The foundation operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="5">$2,186,834 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Notably, the organization maintains a <cite id="6">88.7% program expense ratio</cite> according to its latest filings, ensuring that donor contributions are directed toward direct service delivery. GiveLight distinguishes itself through a model of <cite id="7">direct provision</cite>, which includes not only housing but also <cite id="8">education support and sponsorship programs</cite> to ensure the holistic development of children under its care. The organization has earned a high <cite id="9">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong performance in accountability and leadership. With a <cite id="10">zakat-eligible status</cite>, GiveLight serves as a critical bridge for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill their religious obligations through high-impact orphan care in <cite id="11">Muslim-majority regions</cite>.
